Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup with part of handle root on right; interior: glazed black with reserved band on inside of lip; exterior: lip glazed, handle zone reserved; part of incised handle palmette (taller leaf in added red) and tendril beside handle; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the palmette, compare Munich 1678 (CVA Munich 11, pl. 16; Vierneisel, K. and Kaeser, B., Kunst der Schale. Kultur des Trinkens. Munich 1990, 174, no. 28.12f). For the shape, compare Munich Inv. 9450 (CVA Munich 11, pl. 47, 3-4 and Beil. 11).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.1)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 66, no. 812, pl. XXI, no. 812)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 688, no. 460)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0527) (Phase 1)
